text: and report didn't know at all the tumor
was pressing on the part of the brain
that processes inflammation so although
he was talking I'm communicating and
knowing who I was and everything he
actually wasn't taking in new
information which actually is quite hard
to tell because he seemed quite normal
he just seemed really tired so the day I
was told I came home from hospital that
night and just I think I cried the whole
night and then I said to myself okay
what would he do in this situation right
okay
let's go and find out from the doctors
what we're gonna do and then whatever
time he's got left I'm gonna make it the
best time possible
that's what I did he never saw me cry I
smiled up at my makeup on and hair
everyday um I got him home
we had his favorite ice cream with
magnums we had a lot of magnums sitting
out here you know our life has been full
of laughter and that's what it's been
the last few weeks up until the last 48
hours when he slipped into a sleep but
even you know minutes before he slipped
into that sleep he was smiling at me and
joking and singing Beatles songs
